newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Bakrie says to sell PT Indocopper stake.
newsitem.headline: Bakrie says to sell PT Indocopper stake.

text.p: Indonesia's diversified holding company Bakrie Brothers said on Tuesday it was in negotiations to sell its 49-percent stake in PT Indocopper Investama, which has a 9.36-percent stake in PT Freeport Indonesia.
Freeport Indonesia, 81.28-percent owned by U.S. Freeport McMoRan Copper and Gold Inc, operates one of the world's largest copper and gold mines in Irian Jaya province.

"Bakrie is in negotiations to sell its stake in Indocopper following advice from our advisers Salomon Brothers and Forest International," Bakrie senior vice-president and chief financial officer, Nalin Rathod, said.

"It is not in the interest of the company (Bakrie) to be involved in strategic investments. The money could well be used to strengthen our core businesses," he told reporters after attending a conference organised by PT ING Baring Securities.
Rathod declined to say with whom Bakrie was negotiating, or how much the sale would be worth.
He said Bakrie earned $15 million in dividends from its stake in Indocopper in 1995, which according to him was less than expected.
Bakrie shares rose 25 rupiah to 975 rupiah on a volume of 1.4 million shares by lunchbreak on Tuesday.
